txt.en: 'I cannot say why I am discomfited by the Reeve's demeanor, but his apparent lack of regard for impending invasion by the Khundolar disturbs me. I think it best that we forego Athelward's gracious invitation.\n\n'I think it best that my companions and I leave as soon as possible -- tonight, preferably -- and as secretly as possible. Will you aid us?'

The Reeve looks troubled for a moment, then smiles.

'I understand. They are on a mission of great import and must not delay. We will, of course, prepare as we may here.

'Thank you for delivering Captain Burnoth's message.'
'We are ready to leave when you are.'
Burnoth is discomfited by Reeve Athelward's overly gracious demeanor and apparent disregard for the severity of Rohan's situation.
The Riders Four have left Cliving
Speak with Burnoth to help the Riders Four leave Cliving unnoticed
Burnoth is encamped outside the Mead Hall of Cliving.\n\nYou should speak with Burnoth when you are ready to aid him.
Talk to Reeve Athelward at the Mead Hall of Cliving
Reeve Athelward is in the Mead Hall of Cliving.\n\nBurnoth told you to let Reeve Athelward know that they have graciously declined his invitation and have continued their mission.
